alert.note: Alert for Brown (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 16 at 8:23AM CDT until September 16 at 10:15AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Brown County in west central Texas... * Until 1015 AM CDT. * At 822 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Brownwood, Early, Blanket, Lake Brownwood State Park, Zephyr, Byrds and Owens. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Good Shephard at 11th, Austin Street at Avenue J, Belle Plain at Romines, Cordell at Anderson, Gifford at Beaver, Austin Street at Avenue G, 4th Street at Wood, Magnolia at Belmeade, Willis at Belmeade and West Main at 8th. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
